content: Create Persistent Storage I’ll be using the following directories. Don’t forget to create them. /storage –> /volume1/docker/gphotos-sync/storage /config –> /volume1/docker/gphotos-sync/config
title: Gphotos Sync

content: client_id and client_secret To obtain the client secret, go to the Google Photos API and click on “Enable the Google Photos API”. Create a project and product name. For “Configure your OAuth client” select “Desktop application” and click “Create”. Download the client secret, rename it as client_secret.json and add it to the config directory.
title: Gphotos Sync

content: Docker Command docker run \ -ti \ --name gphotos-sync \ -v /volume1/docker/gphotos-sync/storage:/storage \ -v /volume1/docker/gphotos-sync/config:/config \ gilesknap/gphotos-sync \ /storage Copy the link the first time and paste it into a browser. Allow both permissions (manage and view) Copy the token and paste in the docker container.

content: Like many others, I’m sick of using Wordpress. I’ve finally decided to switch to a static site using Hugo.
title: Hugo

content: Hugo Setup
title: Hugo

content: Install Hugo I’m using the CodeIT Hugo theme. This requires Hugo Extended. Installation via Chocolatey choco install hugo-extended
title: Hugo

content: Create a new site Hugo will create a new site named <my-site> hugo new site <my-site>
title: Hugo

content: Install a theme I like the simplicity and aesthetics of the CodeIT theme. Create a git repository and make the CodeIT repo a submodule of the side directory. cd <my-site> git init git submodule add https://github.com/sunt-programator/CodeIT.git themes/CodeIT
title: Hugo

content: Configure the site In the root of the site, Hugo will create a config.toml file. Here is an example: contentDir = "content" layoutDir = "layouts" publishDir = "public" buildDrafts = false baseURL = "https://yoursite.example.com/" canonifyURLs = true title = "My Hugo Site" [taxonomies] category = "categories" tag = "tags" [params] subtitle = "Hugo is Absurdly Fast!" author = "John Doe"
title: Hugo

content: Create a new post Hugo will create a new post in the content\posts directory. All posts are formatted in Markdown. hugo new posts/my-post.md
title: Hugo

content: Run Local Dev Server hugo serve
